intro: Cinchona tarantaron, commonly known as the red cinchona, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its ornamental value, featuring vibrant red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Cinchona tarantaron is also valued for its medicinal properties, though it is less commonly used than other cinchona species for quinine production.
